results.title: Vision in mathematics: more about Pythagoras
results.brief_description: Develops some ideas arising from the theorum of Pythagoras, including the notion of irrational numbers. Uses the knowledge of Pythagoras’s theorem to calculate the length of a rafter in a roof.

results.title: Vision at night
results.creator_credit: Great Britain. Royal Air Force and Science Films
results.brief_description: The structure of the eye, and its operation, especially at night: visual purple; rods and cones; scanning; adaptation; pre-adaptation; goggles; the value of special diet for night vision.

results.title: Viruses: threshold of life
results.brief_description: With the aid of complex instruments such as the ultra-centrifuge and the electron microscope, the use of tissue cultures and animal experimentation, we see how scientists in a modern virology laboratory explore the nature of viruses, how these viruses exist and how we can use this knowledge to improve our health and well-being.

results.title: Virginia Woolf's criticism of the novel 'Life escapes'
results.creator_credit: Richard Callanan, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The 19th Century Novel”.
Following a dramatised scene from Virginia Woolf’s novel “Life Escapes”, Professor Arnold Kettle argues that Virginia Woolf was not just telling a story but recreating an era of reality and this leads her to break with the traditional form of the novel in a way which emphasises the moment-to-moment impressions of life.

results.brief_description: Fantasy on the theme practice makes perfect. A cut paper and cloth animation for children in which we see all that can be done to convince a little boy to take his violin lessons. No dialogue.

results.title: Violent killer = Violence at noon = Hakuchu no torima
results.brief_description: The disturbing story of a brutal, serial sex murderer, his protective wife and a woman he has previously raped. The two women shield the criminal from the police, each feeling a perverse sense of loyalty to him, one due to marriage, the other because he once saved her life. Oshima presents a taut, intelligent, and visually spellbinding portrait of repression, victimisation, and guilt, using high contrast, frequent jump cuts, isolated framing, changing character perspective, and elliptical narrative to reflect the mental polarity and deviant behavior of an amoral predator. Cast includes Saeda Kawaguchi, Akiko Koyama, Kei Sato, Mutsuhiro Toura, Fumio Watanabe. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Vinyl chloride production
results.creator_credit: Barrie Whatley, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Principles of Chemical Processes”
The plant used at Baglan Bay to convert ethylene and chlorine to vinyl chloride involves three main processes. The first part examines the materials flow and plant operations in each of these processes, and how the three processes are integrated to produce a continuous process. The remainder is concerned with a theoretical analysis of the equipment and operating conditions
